intro: Obaejaca sylvatica, commonly known as the forest hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Obaejaca sylvatica is often found in moist, shaded environments within dense forests. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small wildlife.
